content:
There are many species of birds that can be seen around Inverness. Some of them are:

1. Black-throated Diver
2. Common Sandpiper
3. Common Redshank
4. Arctic Tern
5. Northern Gannet
6. Black Guillemot
7. Great Northern Diver
8. Red-throated Diver

The best locations for birdwatching around Inverness are:

1. Loch Ness
2. The Black Isle
3. Udale Bay
4. The River Ness
5. The Cromarty Firth
6. The Moray Firth
7. The Cairngorms National Park

These locations offer a variety of habitats and ecosystems, making them ideal for birdwatching. Visitors should take care to observe birds from a safe distance, using binoculars or a spotting scope, so as not to disturb them. It is also recommended to visit early in the morning or late in the evening when birds are most active.
